title: allEven with missing expression and loop body

content.description: Consider the following method. Method allEven is intended to return true if all elements in array arr are even numbers; otherwise, it should return false.
content.question: public boolean allEven(int[] arr) { boolean isEven = /* expression */ ; for (int k = 0; k < arr.length; k++) { /* loop body */ } return isEven; } Which of the following replacements for /* expression */ and /* loop body */ should be used so that method allEven will work as intended?

choices.label: /* expression */ /* loop body */ false if ((arr[k] % 2) == 0) isEven = true;
/* expression */ /* loop body */ false if ((arr[k] % 2) != 0) isEven = false; else isEven = true;
/* expression */ /* loop body */ true if ((arr[k] % 2) != 0) isEven = false;
/* expression */ /* loop body */ true if ((arr[k] % 2) != 0) isEven = false; else isEven = true;

content.answer: /* expression */ /* loop body */ true if ((arr[k] % 2) != 0) isEven = false;

skill.text: 2.B: Write program code involving data abstractions.
